title: 114_hr5227
content: The "Library of Congress Modernization Act of 2016" authorizes the National Library Service for the Blind and Physically Handicapped to provide playback equipment in all formats. It also establishes the Library of Congress National Collection Stewardship Fund. The "Library of Congress National Collection Stewardship Fund" is established in the Treasury of the United States for the Librarian of Congress. The Fund can be used for preparing collection materials for long-term storage and for designing, constructing, and equipping preservation facilities for the Library of Congress. The "Library of Congress National Collection Stewardship Fund" is established in accordance with section 1102 of the Legislative Branch Appropriations Act, 2009. The Fund consists of transferred amounts from appropriations for the Library of Congress and the Office of the Architect of the Capitol, as well as amounts appropriated under law. Funds in the Fund remain available until expended, and an annual report is required from the Librarian and the Architect of the Capitol. The Librarian and the Architect of the Capitol must submit a joint report on the Library of Congress National Collection Stewardship Fund annually to the Joint Committee on the Library and the Committees on Appropriations of the House of Representatives and the Senate. Additionally, an initial 5-year plan for expenditures from the Fund must be submitted within 6 months of the enactment of the Act. This section applies to fiscal year 2017 and each subsequent fiscal year. SEC. 4. CONTINUATION OF SERVICE OF RETURNING MEMBERS OF JOINT COMMITTEE ON THE LIBRARY AT BEGINNING OF CONGRESS. During the beginning of a new Congress, members of the Joint Committee on the Library from the previous Congress will continue to serve until new appointments are made for the current Congress. During the transitional period at the start of a new Congress, the Chairman of the Joint Committee on the Library will be determined based on the previous Congress's appointment. If the previous Chairman is appointed to serve on the Joint Committee for the current Congress, they will continue as Chairman during this period. During the transitional period at the start of a new Congress, if the previous Chairman or Vice Chairman is not appointed to the Joint Committee, the Chairman of the Committee on House Administration of the House of Representatives will serve as Chairman. During the transitional period at the start of a new Congress, the Chairman of the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate will serve as Chairman if the previous Chairman was a Senator. This applies to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress and each succeeding Congress.
